source.description: Small tree with element names in mixed namespaces. Note: Use @index to identify elements precisely.

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-1
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - Use undeclared namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-2
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - declare namespace with prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-3
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - declare default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-4
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - duplicate namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-5
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - duplicate default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-6
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - local part of declaration is xml

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-7
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - local part of declaration is xmlns

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-8
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - child inherits namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-9
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - overriding parents namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-10
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - overriding prolog namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-11
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - select child of element overriding parent namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-12
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - select child of element overriding prolog namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-13
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - undeclare namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-14
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - use undeclared parent prefix in child

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-15
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - use undeclared prolog prefix in child

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-16
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - select child of element overriding namespace prefix

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-17
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - child inherits default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-18
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - override parents default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-19
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - override prologs default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-20
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - child inherits overridden parents default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-21
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - child inherits overridden prologs default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-22
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - undeclare default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-23
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - child inherits undeclared default namespace

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-24
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - namespace URI is not string literal

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-25
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - namespace URI is not string literal

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-26
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - test namespace added to statically known namespaces: element content

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-27
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - test namespace added to statically known namespaces: attribute content

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-29
test-case.description: Namespace Declarations - test namespace removed from statically known namespaces after end of element

test-case.name: Constr-namespace-30
test-case.description: Namespace declaration attribute appears after attribute which uses function in that namespace.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-1
test-case.description: A namespace declaration inside a direct element constructor is not in-scope for the next operand of the comma operator.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-2
test-case.description: Element constructors aren't well-formed despite the namespace declarations.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-3
test-case.description: Element constructors aren't well-formed despite the namespace declarations.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-4
test-case.description: A namespace declaration binding to a a one-letter NCName.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-5
test-case.description: Verify the 'xml' prefix is in scope in a direct constructor.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-6
test-case.description: Verify the 'xml' prefix is in scope in a computed constructor.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-7
test-case.description: Default namespace declarations does not affect the default function namespace.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-8
test-case.description: Default namespace declarations does not affect the default function namespace(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-9
test-case.description: Default namespace declarations does not affect the default function namespace(#3).
test-case.test: declare default function namespace "http://example.com"; <e xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" a="{count()}"/>

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-10
test-case.description: Default namespace declarations does not affect the default function namespace(#4).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-11
test-case.description: A name test whose namespace is declared with a default namespace attribute.
test-case.test: declare default function namespace "http://example.com"; <e xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" a="{nametest}"/>

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-12
test-case.description: A name test whose namespace is declared with a default namespace attribute(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-13
test-case.description: A name test whose namespace is declared with a prefixed namespace attribute.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-14
test-case.description: A name test whose namespace is declared with a prefixed namespace attribute(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-15
test-case.description: A namespace must be a literal.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-16
test-case.description: A namespace must be a literal(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-17
test-case.description: A namespace must be a literal, for which bracket-escapes are invalid.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-18
test-case.description: A namespace must be a literal, for which bracket-escapes are invalid(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-19
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with 'instance of'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-20
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with 'treat as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-21
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with 'cast as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-22
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with 'cast as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-23
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with an element name test.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-24
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct default element namespace is used, with an attribute name test.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-25
test-case.description: Test that an empty namespace declaration is handled correctly.
test-case.test: declare namespace b = "http://www.example.com/"; empty(<e xmlns="http://www.example.com/"><d xmlns=""><b/></d></e>/b:d/b:b)

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-26
test-case.description: Ensure that a declaration is only in-scope for the element constructor.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-27
test-case.description: Ensure that when one namespace declaration goes out of scope, that the one above doesn't dissapear.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-28
test-case.description: Ensure that when one namespace declaration goes out of scope, that the one above persists.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-29
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct namespace is used, with 'instance of'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-30
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct namespace is used, with 'treat as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-31
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct namespace is used, with 'cast as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-32
test-case.description: Ensure that the correct namespace is used, with 'cast as'.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-33
test-case.description: Use a namespace binding in range variables that appears after them in query order.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-34
test-case.description: Use an enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-35
test-case.description: Use an enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-36
test-case.description: Use an enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration(#3).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-37
test-case.description: Use an enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration(#3).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-38
test-case.description: Use an inproperly enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-39
test-case.description: Combine an empty default namespace, with a full namespace.
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://example.com/"; document{<p:e xmlns=""/>, count(in-scope-prefixes(<p:e xmlns=""/>))}

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-40
test-case.description: Ensure the namespaces in-scope are outputted.
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://www.example.com/A"; <e xmlns="http://www.example.com/A" xmlns:A="http://www.example.com/C"> <b xmlns:B="http://www.example.com/C"/> </e>/p:b

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-41
test-case.description: Ensure all namespaces in-scope, through a couple of elements, are found by in-scope-prefixes().
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://www.example.com/A"; "START", for $i in in-scope-prefixes(<e xmlns="http://www.example.com/A" xmlns:A="http://www.example.com/C"> <b xmlns:B="http://www.example.com/C" /> </e>/p:b) order by $i return $i, "END"

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-42
test-case.description: A direct element constructor with a redundant, prefixed namespace declaration.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-43
test-case.description: A direct element constructor with a redundant namespace declaration.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-44
test-case.description: Use an inproperly enclosed expression inside an namespace declaration(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-45
test-case.description: Ensure the namespace declaration is output for a copied attribute.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-46
test-case.description: Ensure no declaration is output for the XML namespace.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-47
test-case.description: Use an empty-string namespace declaration.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-48
test-case.description: Declare a prefix that isn't used.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-49
test-case.description: Use a 'declare default element namespace' in addition to binding to the empty prefix.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-50
test-case.description: Ensure undeclarations affect path expressions correctly.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-51
test-case.description: Use an empty-string namespace declaration(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-52
test-case.description: Use an empty-string namespace declaration(#3).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-53
test-case.description: Ensure a namespace undeclaration aren't counted as a namespace binding.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-54
test-case.description: Ensure an undeclaration is treated properly.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-55
test-case.description: A combination of computed and direct constructors with namespace undeclarations.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-56
test-case.description: Check that an attribute name tests properly interact with namespace declarations.
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://example.com/"; <r xmlns:p="http://example.com/"> { <e p:att=""/>/(@att, attribute::att) } </r>

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-57
test-case.description: Attempt an attribute node copy that never will happen.
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://example.com/"; declare namespace p = "http://example.com/"; <r> { <e p:att=""/>/(@att) } </r>

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-58
test-case.description: Use the pre-declared prefixes in element constructors.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-59
test-case.description: Use the {}-escape mechanism.

modified.change: remove error XQST0022, as per bug 22335 (and bbug 13966)

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-61
test-case.description: An non-matched { inside a namespace constructor.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-62
test-case.description: An non-matched } inside a namespace constructor(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-63
test-case.description: An non-matched { inside a namespace constructor(#3).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-64
test-case.description: An non-matched } inside a namespace constructor(#4).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-65
test-case.description: Extract an escaped namespace with fn:namespace-for-prefix().

modified.change: remove error XQST0022, as per bug 22335 (and bbug 13966)

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-67
test-case.description: An non-matched { inside a namespace constructor with content afterwards.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-68
test-case.description: An non-matched } inside a namespace constructor with content afterwards(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-69
test-case.description: An non-matched { inside a namespace constructor with content afterwards(#3).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-70
test-case.description: An non-matched } inside a namespace constructor with content afterwards(#4).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-71
test-case.description: Enclosed expressions cannot be used.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-72
test-case.description: Enclosed expressions cannot be used(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-73
test-case.description: Enclosed expressions containing the empty sequence cannot be used.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-74
test-case.description: Enclosed expressions containing the empty sequence cannot be used(#2).

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-75
test-case.description: Serialize a namespace that has braces. Changed by MHK to avoid problems canonicalizing an invalid namespace URI

modified.change: remove error XQST0022, as per bug 22335 (and bbug 13966)

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-76
test-case.description: Serialize a prefixed namespace that has braces.

modified.change: remove error XQST0022, as per bug 22335 (and bbug 13966)

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-77
test-case.description: Pull out a namespace prefix that shadows another.

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-78
test-case.description: Ensure that namespaces are expanded in the correct places(positive test).
test-case.test: let $e := document{(<X1:L xmlns:X1="http://example.com/URL1">1</X1:L>, <X2:L xmlns:X2="http://example.com/URL2">2</X2:L>)} return <outer xmlns:P="http://example.com/URL1"> { let $outer as element(P:L) := $e/element(P:L) return <inner xmlns:P="http://example.com/URL2"> { let $inner as element(P:L) := $e/element(P:L) return ($outer, $inner) } </inner> } </outer>

test-case.name: K2-DirectConElemNamespace-79
test-case.description: Ensure that namespaces are expanded in the correct places(negative test).
test-case.test: let $e := document{(<X1:L xmlns:X1="http://ns.example.com/URL1">1</X1:L>, <X2:L xmlns:X2="http://ns.example.com/URL2">2</X2:L>)} return <outer xmlns:P="http://ns.example.com/URL1"> { let $outer as element(P:L) := $e/element(P:L) return <inner xmlns:P="http://ns.example.com/URL2"> { let $inner as element(P:L) := $outer return $inner } </inner> } </outer>

test-case.name: DirectConElemNamespace-3
test-case.description: Use the ""-escape mechanism. Modified by MHK to avoid generating output that won't canonicalize - bug 6868

modified.change: remove error XQST0022, as per bug 22335 (and bbug 13966)

test-case.name: K2-ConInScopeNamespace-1
test-case.description: Ensure the in-scope prefixes are correct for all top-level elements.
test-case.test: let $i := document{<e1/>, <e2/>, <e3/>, <e4/>} return (in-scope-prefixes($i/e1), in-scope-prefixes($i/e2), in-scope-prefixes($i/e3), in-scope-prefixes($i/e4))
